main event: A Civil Air Patrol pilot and observer saw a round silver ball flying at high speed at 1000' altitude while on a search mission.
interesting points: The object was flying at a very high speed.
The pilot and observer were on a search mission for the Civil Air Patrol when they saw the object.
The object was described as a round silver ball.
The sighting occurred between 1015 and 1036 CST on October 19, 1952.
The pilot can be reached through the Momence Squadron CAP in Momence, Illinois.
